Created attachment 584057
Screenshot of an affected email

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/535.7 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/16.0.912.63 Safari/535.7

Steps to reproduce:

Attempt to view an email in Original HTML format. The message was sent by the Facebook notification system, but messages from other sources (particularly Yahoo) have been affected also.


Actual results:

The text of the email did not appear; only the pictures and formattings (such as horizontal rules) appeared. Even when I clicked "Show Remote Content", the text and background, etc, did not appear. The text only appeared when I selected "View message body in Simple HTML" from the View menu.


Expected results:

The full content of the email should have (as it would have until Thunderbird v7, and still does on Windows).

> The text of the email did not appear; only the pictures and formattings

This kind of phenomenon is observed when <style> is placed at wrong place(e.g. <style> in <body> instead of correct <head> section.)
Phenomenon may depend on that HTML5 parser is used or not.

Is html5.parser.enable=false(set it via Config Editor) a workaround?
